label: Description
value: While linen worked in multicolored silk, now faded, in a design of flowers, animals, people, architectural motifs, numerals and alphabet.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk on linen Technique: embroidered

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Herman A. Elsberg on the Fortieth Anniversary of the Museum

label: Description
value: Bright blue satin with ground figures of stiffly symmetrical acanthus leaves. Wreaths, rosettes, and acanthus leaves brocaded in plain and frisé gold thread.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metallic thread Technique: fancy satin brocaded with gold

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Herman A. Elsberg on the Fortieth Anniversary of the Museum

label: Description
value: Border woven to match 1937-63-3. Neo-classical pattern of laurel wreath and acanthus leaves in the form of a lyre brocaded in gold thread on a bright blue satin ground with a monochrome figure of slender leaves; with wide and narrown gold bands top and bottom.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metal-wrapped silk threads, smooth and frisé Technique: 8-harness satin patterned with continuous and discontinuous supplementary wefts and supplementary binding warp

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Herman A. Elsberg on the Fortieth Anniversary of the Museum

value: Border fragment with two horizontal rows of alternating trefoil and willow branch in brown and yellow on green satin ground.

value: Medium: silk Technique: satin lampas plain compound satin

label: Description
value: Vertical rectangle with outcurve base. Blue and white landscape with tall ruined buildings, walled garden at left. Butterfly and birds in air. Base has drapery festoon.

Tile panel composed of six square tiles

label: Description
value: Vertical rectangle with urn and flowers in manganese violet on white ground. Shoulder of urn with pendant drapery and band of ellipses enclosing diagonal lines. Continuous vine-and-leaf border with oviform figures in the center.

label: Object Type
value: Tile panel composed of six square tiles

label: Dimensions
value: H x W x D (Together): 25.5 x 38 cm (10 1/16 x 14 15/16 in.)

label: Description
value: Square tile with cobalt blue figure of mounted lancer charging toward the left, enclosed in an octofoil rosette reserved in white on a ground of stippled manganese violet. Heart shape reserves at the corner.

label: Description
value: Square tile with octofoil rosette centered with double walled circle enclosing landscape with shepherd and staff, facing right, in cobalt blue. Ground stippled manganese violet. Heart-shaped reserves at corners with short curved lines along one side.

label: Description
value: Earthenware in manganese, white and blue.

label: Description
value: Vertical rectangles. Each tile with identical pattern of two flowers and leaves on continuous scrolling stem. One flower faces the observer and the other is in profile. Manganese violet on white ground.

label: Dimensions
value: H x W x D (lying flat): 6.5 x 6.8 x 12.8 cm (2 9/16 x 2 11/16 x 5 1/16 in.)

Study for the Violet Sargent Bronze Plaque in the Art Institute of Chicago

label: Description
value: Young woman, three-quarter-length, seated with head in profile, directed to right; hands in lap.  Enclosed in rectangle with filling of curved lines in upper right corner.  Below in small square, a bust with head in three-quarter view to right.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and purple ink on cream laid paper

label: Provenance
value: From the collection of Homer Saint-Gaudens

label: Notes
value: Young woman, three-quarter-length, seated with head in profile, directed to right; hands in lap. Enclosed in rectangle with filling of curved lines in upper right corner. Below in small square, a bust with head in three-quarter view to right.
Studies for the Violet Sargent Bronze Plaque in the Art Institute of Chicago

label: Description
value: Two figures: at left a seated woman, head in profile facing right, leaning on right arm with left hand on knee; at right, in rectangular frame, a woman in a long gown standing facing the observer.

label: Provenance
value: From the collection of Homer Saint-Gaudens

label: Notes

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Edward F. Caldwell and Company

label: Description
value: Rectangular darning sampler with fifteen darning crosses and two corner mends, with picot edgings and hemstitching. In the center square, where the foundation fabric has been cut away and replaced, the inscription GD 1711, surmounted by a crown, is embroidered in red cross stitch.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk embroidery, linen foundation Technique: embroidered in running (pattern darning) and cross stitches on plain weave Label: linen embroidered with silk in pattern darning and cross stitches

label: Description
value: Small wooden block with raised design of an open rose and leaves.

label: Credit line
value: gift of Mrs. Harry Horton Benkard

label: Description
value: Brocaded sarong (kain songket) with a maroon silk warp and purple silk weft, brocaded with an all-over repeating leaf pattern in gold thread. Geometric borders brocaded in gold and a wide center band heavily brocaded in gold in the stylized "lawi ayam" or 'cockerel's tail feathers' motif.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metallic threads Technique: plain weave with discontinuous supplementary weft patterning (brocade)

label: Description
value: Made of strap-like scrolls of iron joined in reverse position and terminating in a leaf-shaped bobeche with four prickets, the central one threaded at the base.  Outer edges of scrolls with double frill of continuous, pierced leaf ornament.

label: Provenance
value: Edward F. Caldwell; 1937: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Edward F. Caldwell & Company

label: Description
value: Couchant lion with haunches spread, the back spanned by a flat plate with three holes, probably for attaching to base of candlestick. Protruding tongue, two tails, shell and volute scrolls.

label: Provenance
value: Edward F. Caldwell; 1937: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Edward F. Caldwell and Company

label: Description
value: Pair of rectangular shoe buckles, the simple borders with two rows of small clear glass pastes simulating faceted diamonds.

label: Description
value: Deep round collar of net with an alloever embroidered floral design. Sawtooth scallops and tiny dots powdered over the ground. Initial "C" embroidered in center back.

label: Description
value: Cuff of black taffeta edged with two ruffles of black Chantilly style lace.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: bobbin lace, Chantilly style

label: Description
value: Dark brown ground with powdered design of trefoil in light browns and three berries (?) and leaves in green, purple and white.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: wool, cotton Techinque: printed on plain weave

label: Description
value: Cream coloured ground with broad vertical stripes of closely massed slender foliate design in browns and black, alternating with tiny rose buds in pink and blue.
